title: How to use the functions
text: package provides helper functions conveniently change extract metadata laz files. makes use lidR lasR packages.

title: How to use the functions
text: Use function plot_extent() plot bounding boxes laz files folder top interactive map (using mapview package).

title: How to use the functions
text: Use function get_density() extract approximate pulse density (first/last-return ) laz files. function header lasfiles read density calculated bounding box data file number first-returns. take account parts bounding box missing data, hence density reflect density calculates e.g. lidR. However, much faster read entire file density approximately entire bounding box point data.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jens Wiesehahn. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wiesehahn J (2024). managelidar: Manage Lidar Data Files. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://wiesehahn.github.io/managelidar/, https://github.com/wiesehahn/managelidar.
code: @Manual{,   title = {managelidar: Manage Lidar Data Files},   author = {Jens Wiesehahn},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://wiesehahn.github.io/managelidar/},   url = {https://github.com/wiesehahn/managelidar}, }

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: goal managelidar facilitate handling management lidar data files (*.laz), e.g. provide functions get quick overview file attributes. facilitate quality check incoming ALS data. managelidar makes use functions provided {lidR} {lasR}. Functions reading entire LAZ files, require long computations large collections data. Instead attriibutes read file header.

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: can install development version managelidar GitHub : functions depend lasR package (version >= 0.5.6) hosted https://r-lidar.r-universe.dev/lasR manually install advance :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("wiesehahn/managelidar") # Install lasR in R: install.packages("lasR", repos = c("https://r-lidar.r-universe.dev", "https://cran.r-project.org"))

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: basic function queries spatial extents lidar data files (*.laz) given folder data headers (without reading actual point cloud data). returns dataframe can used data management steps.

title: Check file names — check_names
text: Checks file names according standard File names following schema: "prefix_UTMzone_minx_miny_tilesize_region_acquisitiondate.laz" e.g. "3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz"

title: Check file names — check_names
code: check_names(path, prefix = "3dm", zone = 32, region = "ni", date = NULL)

title: Check file names — check_names
text: path path laz file directory contains laz files prefix 3 letter character. Naming prefix (defaults "3dm") zone 2 digits integer. UTM zone (defaults 32) region 2 letter character. Region abbreviation (defaults "ni") date YYYYMMDD. (optional) acquisition date

title: Check file names — check_names
text: dataframe name_is, name_should, correct

title: Check file names — check_names

Get the Coordinate Reference system of laz files — get_crs
text: path path laz file directory contains laz files full.names Whether return full file path just file name (default)

title: Get the Coordinate Reference system of laz files — get_crs
text: dataframe file crs (EPSG)

title: Get the Coordinate Reference system of laz files — get_crs
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package="managelidar") get_crs(f) #> Warning: This LAS object stores the CRS as WKT. 0 returned; use 'wkt()' instead. #> Warning: This LAS object stores the CRS as WKT. 0 returned; use 'wkt()' instead. #> Warning: This LAS object stores the CRS as WKT. 0 returned; use 'wkt()' instead. #> Warning: This LAS object stores the CRS as WKT. 0 returned; use 'wkt()' instead. #>                                file   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832

title: Get the approximate pulse density of lasfiles — get_density
text: function header lasfiles read density calculated bounding box data file number first-returns. take account parts bounding box missing data, hence density reflect density calculates e.g. lidR. However, much faster read entire file density approximately entire bounding box point data.

title: Plot the extent of lasfiles — plot_extent
